intro: Virola elongata var. subcordata, commonly known as the scarlet burl wood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myristicaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and produces fragrant, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its wood is highly valued for its durability and unique grain patterns, making it a sought-after material in traditional craftsmanship. The species also plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting a variety of wildlife.
